info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 19 at 9:38AM CDT until March 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
info.description:
...RED FLAG CONDITIONS EXPECTED WEDNESDAY ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...
.Strong wind gusts above 45 mph are expected within the Mississippi River Delta this afternoon in addition to low fuel moisture near 10 percent and minimum relative humidity values as low as 20 percent. These conditions will allow for Red Flag fire weather conditions through this evening.
The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 7 PM CDT this evening.
* WIND... Southerly winds sustained above 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph.
* HUMIDITY... Relative humidity values as low as 20 percent.
* FUEL MOISTURE... Fuel moisture at or below 10 percent.
* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS... LOW HUMIDITY... AND LOW FUEL MOISTURE FOR EASTERN ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL
